title: Up and coming
text: Impressed by the improvement works which are on going.  The arch is new and a great memorial to the slave trade.  However, it will be really excellent when the ship is completed and open.  Stopped ro 10 minutes and saw it all.

title: A haunting and powerful experience.
text:
Visiting the Door of No Return in Ouidah was one of the most moving experiences of my trip. Standing on the path where so many were forced into slavery was heartbreaking and thought-provoking. The monument is striking, and the stories shared by our guide truly brought this history to life.

I can’t recommend Orisha Trails enough ! They organized our tour with so much professionalism and care. Their deep knowledge of Benin’s history and culture added so much depth to the experience. If you’re planning a visit, they’re the guide you need for an unforgettable journey.

Visiting the Door of No Return in Ouidah was one of the most moving experiences of my trip. Standing on the path where so many were forced into slavery was heartbreaking and thought-provoking. The monument is striking, and the stories shared by our guide truly brought this history to life.

I can’t recommend Orisha Trails enough ! They organized our tour with so much professionalism and care. Their deep knowledge of Benin’s history and culture added so much depth to the experience. If you’re planning a visit, they’re the guide you need for an unforgettable journey.

title: Znaczący symbol.
text: Ta symboliczna brama ma upamiętniać tysiące niewolników wywiezionych z Afryki Zachodniej [ i nie tylko ].Betonowa brama z elementami z brązu powstała z inicjatywy UNESCO w roku 1995 . Niedawno była wyremontowana i prezentuje się okazale .Niestety w trakcie festiwalu Vodun Days nie było możliwości podejść pod samą bramę .Na plaży przy samej bramie była ustawiona wielka estrada . Wstęp pod bramę był tylko dla specjalnych gości bo wokół niej był sektor dla  VIP. Byłem na nocnym koncercie i podświetlona brama robi duże wrażenie .Następnego dnia byłem tu przed południem ale wejście pod bramę nadal nie było możliwe .Na plaży wokół bramy był niewiarygodny tłok i tysiące świętujących ludzi . Była niesamowita atmosfera wielkiego święta i ogólnej radości .
translated_text: Ta symboliczna brama ma upamiętniać tysiące niewolników wywiezionych z Afryki Zachodniej [i nie tylko].Betonowa brama z elementami z brązu powstała z inicjatywy UNESCO w roku 1995. It is not the end of the world that we are talking about. We are happy to say that the Vodun Days party is not the only way to go. This is why you are looking for a VIP service. Byłem na nocnym koncercie i podświetlona brama robi duże wrażenie.Następnego dnia byłem tu przed południem ale wejście pod bramę nadal nie było możliwe.Na plaży wokół bramy był niewiarygodny tłok i tysiące świętujących ludzi . Była niesamowita atmosfera wielkiego święta i ogólnej radości.

Trovo significativo invece che poco più in là per l’anno della Misericordia, sia stata creata la porte de l’évangélisation.

text: We were told that the local authorities are developing the site and will include a model of a slave ship which will demonstrate how people were packed in for the trip across the Atlantic. While we were there the site was surrounded by a fence so we could only see the top of the monument. The gate appears to be a striking monument but it is hard to say much about it right now since it looks like a construction zone.

title: À faire
text:
Un très beau parcours chargé d’histoire à faire. Nous conseillons de prendre un guide à l’entrée de la ville (ils ont leur carte pro autour du cou) car il faut faire toute la route avant la porte, avec les étapes dans le village. 
Nous surtout ne pas prendre le guide via le temple des pythons car les prix sont exagérés. 
Attention ce parcours est en travaux au moins jusqu’en décembre 2022, cela est faisable mais ça gâche considérablement la visite ( aller- retours des camions, route retournée et porte du non retour cachée par les palissades).
translated_text: A very beautiful route full of history to do. We recommend taking a guide at the entrance to the city (they have their pro card around their neck) because you have to do the whole road before the gate, with the stages in the village. We especially do not take the guide via the temple of the pythons because the prices are exaggerated. Be careful this route is under construction at least until December 2022, it is feasible but it considerably spoils the visit (back and forth of trucks, road turned and door of no return hidden by the palisades).

title: La Porte du Non Retour , En mémoire des Esclaves embarqués de Force pour les Amériques !
text:
Après avoir franchi la longue route dite des esclaves depuis Ouidah , ceux ci après avoir été plusieurs fois humiliés , pour leur ôter toute dignité , se retrouvent au bord de l'océan pour être transportés  entravés et entassés  ,dans les cales des navires négriers européens , en partance pour les Amériques . 

En 1995 , l'Unesco a fait ériger ce mémorial en forme d'arc bordé de sculptures témoignant des nombreux esclaves qui sont passés ici au nombre de plus d'un million . La case de garde est toujours présente sur la plage , comme une plaie qui se montre encore . Bien sûr , il faut noter que le commerce des esclaves a été  possible grâce aux actions militaires des petits royaumes de la côte Sud dès 1e 17 ème siècle , puis du royaume du Dahomey , dirigé par des rois Africains , contre leurs voisins , et qui ont largement alimentés les négriers . Il y a des acheteurs parce qu'il y a des vendeurs africains , qui font commerce des êtres humains . Il ne faut jamais l'oublier , au risque de laisser à croire à des inexactitudes , qui dédouaneraient l'Afrique dans cet honteux commerce !    

Le site est actuellement en cours de rénovation et entouré de palissades , ce qui laisse peu de possibilité de le montrer . Toutefois ,lors d'une précédente visite , j'avais pris des photos par beau temps qui montrent bien les lieux . Ce lieu de mémoire est une leçon pour les nouvelles générations  qui ont tendance à l'oubli , alors que cela est encore réel sous d'autres formes dans certaines sociétés
translated_title: The Door of No Return, In memory of the Slaves forcibly embarked for the Americas!
translated_text: After crossing the long so-called slave route from Ouidah, these, after having been humiliated several times, to take away all their dignity, find themselves at the edge of the ocean to be transported, shackled and crammed into the holds of European slave ships, leaving for the Americas. In 1995, UNESCO erected this memorial in the shape of an arch lined with sculptures testifying to the many slaves who passed through here, numbering more than a million. The guardhouse is still present on the beach, like a wound that still shows itself. Of course, it should be noted that the slave trade was possible thanks to the military actions of the small kingdoms of the South coast from the 17th century, then of the kingdom of Dahomey, led by African kings, against their neighbors, and which largely supplied the slave traders. There are buyers because there are African sellers who trade in human beings. We must never forget this, at the risk of giving rise to inaccuracies, which would exonerate Africa in this shameful trade! The site is currently being renovated and surrounded by fences, which leaves little possibility of showing it. However, during a previous visit, I took photos in good weather which show the place well. This place of memory is a lesson for the new generations who tend to forget, while this is still real in other forms in certain societies

title: EMOUVANT
text: Visite plus qu'émouvante pour qui bénéficiera de la présente et des explications d'un guide (on en trouve juste devant). Car ce n'est pas qu'une simple porte mais un voyage dans des temps bien sombres auquel vous êtes ici conviés. Emu, donc !
translated_text: A more than moving visit for those who will benefit from the present and the explanations of a guide (there are some right in front). Because it is not just a simple door but a journey into very dark times to which you are invited here. Emotional, then!

title: Vitally important site to see and an important monument of remembrance
text:
Located a 4km or so walk from Ouidah, this is worth the trip out. The monument is striking both in size and as a structure of remembrance for everyone who was forced to leave these shores. 

There are guides waiting at the gate as well as a couple of places to get a cold beer/some food. 'Jah et fils' right opposite has some cool music and nice drinks - also possible to camp there. There are a few souvenir shops/craft markets nearby as well.

title: Tristesse et recueillement
text:
Après avoir fait le parcours de la route des esclaves, on termine à la Porte du non retour. De cet endroit, les esclaves étaient embarqués sur le bateaux pour les emmener  loin de leurs familles et pays.

Il est triste de voir jusqu'ou l'être humain s'est abaissé. Histoire triste, choquante et un lieu de recueillement, priant pour que de telles horreurs de se répètent jamais

Pour vous y rendre, ou pour tout autre déplacement à Cotonou et environs, voici un contact sûr :
   Guide touristique – Taxi, Henri Nobime C.S.
   +229 96 21 39 74 (WhatsApp)
   +229 90 94 87 66
   +229 98 80 89 12
translated_text: After following the slave route, we end at the Door of No Return. From this place, slaves were boarded on boats to take them away from their families and countries. It is sad to see how low human beings have sunk. A sad, shocking story and a place of contemplation, praying that such horrors will never be repeated. To get there, or for any other trip to Cotonou and the surrounding area, here is a safe contact: Tourist guide - Taxi, Henri Nobime CS +229 96 21 39 74 (WhatsApp) +229 90 94 87 66 +229 98 80 89 12

title: Incontournable
text:
Un lieu de mémoire aussi important que l'Ile de Gorée au Sénégal.
Espéront que l'état béninois réhabilite enfin ce lieu si sacré.
translated_text: A place of memory as important as Gorée Island in Senegal. Let's hope that the Beninese government finally rehabilitates this sacred place.

title: Très émouvant, à condition d'avoir un guide
text: Tant une partie très sombre de l'histoire mondiale est évoquée par cette porte. Il faut absolument être accompagné d'un guide si vous voulez comprendre ce qui s'est passé pour ces millions d'hommes et de femmes forcés de quitter leur pays pour toujours.
translated_title: Very moving, provided you have a guide
translated_text: Such a dark part of world history is evoked by this gate. It is essential to be accompanied by a guide if you want to understand what happened to these millions of men and women forced to leave their countries forever.

title: Make do with history + imagination
text:
Really, this attraction hasn’t really been developed for tourism. It may be plus as you get the original state and you may have to dig into history and use your imagination to re- create this slave trade route. Other than that, there isn’t much to do here; just take pictures .

The Ghanaians did a better job of this with the Elmina Castle.

title: Décevant
text: Franchement déçus par les lieux et l'état de délabrement de la Porte qui n'est même pas rénovée : les parties cassées ont tout simplement été retirées ou déposées. La qualité des matériaux (béton recouvert de plaques de bronze) face à la mer 🙄 laissait pourtant présager ce délabrement. Le tout sur un site qui serait très beau si seulement les ordures étaient ramassées... Quel gâchis!
translated_text: Frankly disappointed by the place and the state of disrepair of the Gate which has not even been renovated: the broken parts have simply been removed or deposited. The quality of the materials (concrete covered with bronze plates) facing the sea 🙄 nevertheless suggested this disrepair. All this on a site which would be very beautiful if only the rubbish were collected... What a waste!

title: TOUR DE VILLE
text: Sur notre route,nous avons rencontré l'excellence, Il mérite d'être célébré.Il détient ce don de maintenir votre émotion.Il n'est pas formé pour ca,c'est inné en lui. Merci encore
translated_text: On our journey, we encountered excellence. He deserves to be celebrated. He has this gift of holding your emotion. He is not trained for this, it is innate in him. Thank you again.

title: Nichts Historisches
text: Diese Porte ist kein historisches Bauwerk, sondern ein modernes Denkmal. Wer hier Authentisches sucht, wird nicht fündig. Auch die Route des Esclaves bietet eher wenig in Bezug zum Sklavenhandel. Die geführte Tour zog sich zu lange hin und der Guide gab viel zu viele Informationen über irgendwelche regionalen Könige und in dem Zusammenhang könnte man die weniger interessanten Figuren am Wegesrand anschauen. Alles in allem die 5.000 CFA nicht wert, die der guide pro Person im Namen des Office du Tourisme von uns verlangt hat.
translated_text: Diese Porte ist kein historisches Bauwerk, sondern ein modernes Denkmal. Wer hier Authentisches sucht, wird nicht fündig. title: Monument in honor of the slaves
text:
This is a monument built on the beach to honour the slaves that were taken away by sea. It was 2 mins walk from our hotel (Diaspora) and when we got there, there was no one manning the gates. We just went in, looked around and took some pictures. When we were leaving we saw a man who was trying to ask us questions. My friend who stayed at another hotel (Djegba) said they were asked to pay some money to get in. 

We went round without a guide. Having done the slave routes in Nigeria and Ghana, I didn't feel a huge need to get one here and I didn't see any there to use. 

Remember that just opposite are souvenir shops and stores where you can buy bottled water for cheaper.

title: Pay even if it is for free
text: I wanted to see the place myself but of course was noticed by a local guide, who offered his attendance and help. When I said that do not need any help, he said that I should pay at least a small amount to people, who sweep the area around the monument. I just refused and left. I cannot imagine that the beach area is swept up... The place is much less interesting compared to the House of slaves on Gorée island in Senegal. It is just an arch... Close to the arch there are some abandon buildings that were either used for keeping slaves before sending them to America or just modern buildings that look like old :)

title: Bellissimo
text: La spiaggia è di una bellezza indescrivibile, la porta del non ritorno è un monumento che ricorda un momento della storia davvero triste!
translated_text: The window is an indescribable beauty, the gate of no scene is a monument that celebrates a sad moment in the story!

title: la route dezs esclaves à pied !
text:
nous avons profité d'un ciel un peu couvert pour marcher de notre hôtel "le Jardin secret" à la porte du non retour.
(9km aller et autant pour le retour). notre guide Prospère en moto marquant les arrêts et nous donnant les explications sur les arbres et divinités. Dépêchez vous de contempler , les statues vieillissent mal !
translated_title: the road of slaves on foot!
translated_text: We took advantage of a slightly overcast sky to walk from our hotel "le Jardin secret" to the door of no return. (9km there and the same for the return). Our guide Prospère on a motorbike marked the stops and gave us explanations about the trees and divinities. Hurry up and contemplate, the statues age badly!

title: Lieu chargé d'histoire
text:
Dans les différentes activités de Ouidah, il y a des locaux qui proposent de faire le guide. Et cela est clairement conseillé, sauf si vous avez un guide/chauffeur. 

Cela commence par une place suivi par la route emprunté par les esclaves (plusieurs Km) sur lequel il y a de nombreuses statues avec leurs significations. 
Et termine au niveau du front de mer avec la porte du non retour. 

Pas de pancarte racontant l'histoire. 

Pas de frais d'entrée, activité gratuite.
translated_text: In the various activities of Ouidah, there are locals who offer to act as guides. And this is clearly recommended, unless you have a guide/driver. It starts with a square followed by the road used by the slaves (several km) on which there are many statues with their meanings. And ends at the waterfront with the door of no return. No sign telling the story. No entrance fee, free activity.

title: No return...but i returned!
text:
It helped open my eyes to the impact of slave trade!
Stories about the point of no return filled my heart with heaviness!
translated_text:
It helped open my eyes to the impact of slave trade!
Stories about the point of no return filled my heart with heaviness!

title: Route of the slaves
text: It's the ending point of the route of the slaves. The path is amazing to understand how the slaves wore trade and how they wore preperated to the jorney across the atlantic!
translated_text: It's the ending point of the route of the slaves. The path is amazing to understand how the slaves wore trade and how they wore preperated to the jorney across the atlantic!

title: Un grand moment d'émotion.
text: Un conseil, ne venez pas directement à la porte. Partez du fort des portugais et prenez un guide qui va vous faire découvrir le chemin que prenaient les esclaves entre leur lieu d'enfermement et l'embarquement. Le chemin est balisé d'étape matérialisé par des statues et lieux de recueillement. Notre guide s'appel  Prospère je vous le recommande. La porte est majestueuse en bord de plage. Il faut imaginer le lieux lors de la fête du vaudou quand les pèlerins viennent du Brésil, d'Haïti ou des Antilles pour commémorer leurs ancêtres.
translated_text: A word of advice: don't go straight to the gate. Start from the Portuguese fort and hire a guide who will show you the path that slaves took between their place of confinement and embarkation. The path is marked with stages, marked by statues and places of contemplation. Our guide's name is Prospère, and I recommend him. The gate is majestic on the beach. Imagine the place during the voodoo festival when pilgrims come from Brazil, Haiti, or the West Indies to commemorate their ancestors.

title: Know your history!
text: This was very insightful! You think you know when you've read but there's nothing like seeing history with your own eyes. Every African person or person of African descent needs to make it a point to visit sites that hold history of the trans Atlantic slave trade & colonialism for your own enlightenment.
translated_text: This was very insightful! You think you know when you've read but there's nothing like seeing history with your own eyes. Every African person or person of African descent needs to make it a point to visit sites that hold history of the trans Atlantic slave trade & colonialism for your own enlightenment.

title: Reflecting on the past
text:
This point is reflective. It takes your mind back to the days of slavery in Whydah and West Africa. 

It is well managed and guides are available to take you around and tell the tale. There are art shops close by that you can purchase art works and antiques.

Watch out if you are driving so that your car do not get sunk on the sandy road.

title: Il faut se souvenir
text: Toute la route du centre ville de Ouidah à la porte du non retour est très chargée d’histoire. Les esclaves marchaient depuis la place du centre jusqu’à l’océan en sachant qu'ils allaient mourir ou quitter leur continent pour toujours en tous cas ! Triste pan de notre histoire !
translated_text: The entire road from Ouidah city center to the Gate of No Return is steeped in history. Slaves walked from the city center square to the ocean knowing they would either die or leave their continent forever! A sad part of our history!

title: Monument commémoratif
text:
Symbole très fort, cette porte représente le passage des esclaves qui partaient de Ouidah (Fort Judah) vers les Amériques. Même si le bâtiment en soit n'est pas particulièrement beau, prenez le temps de suivre la route des esclaves depuis le centre historique de Ouidah. Le long de la voie se trouvent les statues-symboles des rois de l'ancien Dahomey. Au bout de la piste (praticable en voiture) la porte ouvre la vue sur la plage. Jolie ballade et indispensable pour bien comprendre l'histoire du lieu.
Pour plus d'infos avant ou après votre voyage je conseille une super Bd, dont les tomes 3 et 4 se passent au Bénin et parlent de la question de l'esclavage. C'est une Bd historique dont les informations sont sûres. C'est "Les passagers du vent" de François Bourgeon
translated_text: A very powerful symbol, this gate represents the passage of slaves leaving Ouidah (Fort Judah) for the Americas. Even if the building itself is not particularly beautiful, take the time to follow the slave route from the historic center of Ouidah. Along the route are the statues-symbols of the kings of ancient Dahomey. At the end of the track (passable by car) the gate opens onto the view of the beach. A lovely walk and essential for understanding the history of the place. For more information before or after your trip, I recommend a great comic book, volumes 3 and 4 of which take place in Benin and deal with the issue of slavery. It's a historical comic book with reliable information. It's "Les passagers du vent" by François Bourgeon

title: Port Of No Return
text:
I had a chilling feeling when I was told the story behind this historic center.
This is the point where slaves where shipped to sea.
translated_text:
I had a chilling feeling when I was told the story behind this historic center.
This is the point where slaves where shipped to sea.

Although it is on the beach, the monument evokes a strong sense of sadness and is definitely worth a visit. There is no museum or explanations - just a significant point of reflection.

Although it is on the beach, the monument evokes a strong sense of sadness and is definitely worth a visit. There is no museum or explanations - just a significant point of reflection.

Très bonne explications et très intéressante et émouvante randonnée.

title: No museum, research the area and history before arriving
text: The Benin Government trying to help their citizens and visitors understand the history of the area and what has occurred here. This is a monument not museum to the history of what took place here. Research the trail and spend time to reflect this location and area before coming to the area.

title: Pour la mémoire
text:
Au moins 13 millions de personnes sont passés sur cette plage. Beaucoup plus parrait il. 
Mémoire d'une histoire malsaine ! 

Faire la route en entier
translated_text: At least 13 million people have passed through this beach. Apparently, many more. A reminder of a sinister history! Take the entire route.

title: The remembering is necessary
text: Unlike 'gate of no return' or 'door of no return' which is a feature of every slave fort or castle as the poor souls who were taken through them would not be coming back to their homeland. this instead is a monument on a beach where such actions took place. It is not spectacular but certainly thought provoking with its carved images being especially poignant.
translated_text: Unlike 'gate of no return' or 'door of no return' which is a feature of every slave fort or castle as the poor souls who were taken through them would not be coming back to their homeland. this instead is a monument on a beach where such actions took place. It is not spectacular but certainly thought provoking with its carved images being especially poignant.

title: Time and Place for Reflection
text:
This has to be one of the most moving experiences in the world. A place where so many lives were destroyed by our, so called religious, forefathers in pursuit of obscene profits at the expense of so many lives. Millions were taken and transported from their families and Fatherland.
This monument provides the opportunity for peaceful reflection.
translated_text:
This has to be one of the most moving experiences in the world. A place where so many lives were destroyed by our, so called religious, forefathers in pursuit of obscene profits at the expense of so many lives. Millions were taken and transported from their families and Fatherland.

title: Il festival del vudù.
text: Ieri, come ogni 10 gennaio, in alcune città del Benin si festeggia il vudu con alcuni festival nelle principali città, tra le quali Ouidah. Io ho avuto il privilegio di essere presente al festival, che dura tutta la giornata e prevede una sfilata di personaggi che arrivano da diverse regioni del paese (e anche dall'estero) vestiti con costumi tradizionali particolari. Il festival ha luogo nel grande spiazzo sul mare dove si trova la Porta del non ritorno. Centinaia di persone vi assistono, non solo turisti, alcuni trovando posto sulle sedie di plastica messe a disposizione dal Comune cittadino sotto ai tendoni allestiti per l'occasione; ma i più camminano per il piazzale per assistere alle varie cerimonie vudu. Il monumento è molto semplice e il festival ne esalta il significato e la portata storica. Coloro che sfilano durante il festival la attraversano. La porta poggia su un piedistallo e bisogna salire alcuni gradini per raggiungerla. Dalla porta è bellissimo il panorama sull'oceano.
translated_text: Ieri, come ogni 10 gennaio, in alcune città del Benin si festeggia il vudu con alcuni festival nelle principali città, tra le quali Ouidah. Io ho avuto il privilegio di essere presente au festival, che dura tutta tutta la giornata e prevede una sfilata di personaggi che arrino d'varie regioni del paese (and also from all'estero) vestiti con costumi tradizionali particolari. There is a great festival to be had on the sea if you find the Porta del non ritorno. Centinaia di persone vi assistono, non solo turisti, alcuni trovando posto sulle sedie di plastica mass adisposizione dal Comune cittadino sotto ai tendii aleestiti per occassione; But I moved further to the square to attend the varied ceremony. The monument is very simple and the festival does not express its significance in the historical port. The color changes during the festival. The porta poggia su un pedistallo e bisogna salire alcuni gradini per raggiungerla. From there it is a beautiful panorama of the ocean.

title: Rich in history
text: Location is rich in history with some early morning exercise on the beach too. The view at sunset is fantastic.
translated_text: Location is rich in history with some early morning exercise on the beach too. The view at sunset is fantastic.

title: témoin d’ une periode affreuse
text:
ce genre d’ endroit me rends toujours mal à l’ aise, comme à Zanzibar, à l’ île de Gorée et tant d’ autres endroits ou la crime contre l’ humanité de l’ esclavage a fait ravage.

Le monument est bien concu, et bien entretenu ( pas évident du tout au Bénin)
translated_text: This kind of place always makes me uncomfortable, like in Zanzibar, on Gorée Island and so many other places where the crime against humanity of slavery wreaked havoc. The monument is well designed and well maintained (not easy at all in Benin)

title: Porte du non retour
text: This place is an inner journey, it makes you reflect on history and what people are capable of doing to each other. Worthwhile to visit.
translated_text: This place is an inner journey, it makes you reflect on history and what people are capable of doing to each other. Worthwhile to visit.

title: De la gravité
text:
Comment ne pas être touché par ce lieu d'où furent embarqués des millions d'esclaves dont beaucoup n'ont même jamais atteint la destination ?
Cette porte symbolique est là pour rappeler ces siècles de commerce du "bois d'ébène" (les esclaves) organisé et planifié par les dynasties royales locales au bénéfice des commerçants négriers portugais, français, hollandais.
À voir absolument pour se recueillir sur cette superbe plage qui vit tant d'esclaves partir vers l'enfer.
translated_text: How can one not be moved by this place from which millions of slaves were embarked, many of whom never even reached their destination? This symbolic gate is there to recall these centuries of trade in "ebony wood" (slaves) organized and planned by local royal dynasties for the benefit of Portuguese, French, and Dutch slave traders. A must-see to reflect on this superb beach that saw so many slaves leave for hell.

title: pour l'histoire et l'océan
text: Pour l'histoire et l'océan, à voir si vous passez au Bénin, à une petit heure de Cotonou en direction du Togo. Il y a des guides pour avoir des précisions et quelques cabannes pour les souvenirs. Océan tumultueux.
translated_text: For history and the ocean, see it if you're passing through Benin, about an hour from Cotonou on the way to Togo. There are guides for details and a few cabins for souvenirs. The ocean is turbulent.

title: Une émotion rare
text:
La.route des esclaves et cette porte du non retour est un endroit de souvenir intense. Il faut se faire guider pour comprendre ce qu on pu endurer ces hommes
A faire nécessairement
translated_text: The slave route and this door of no return is a place of intense memory. You must be guided to understand what these men endured. It is essential to do so.

title: Emotion !!!
text:
La route des esclaves est une balade très interessante et vive en emotions lorsqu on imagine les horreurs qu ont du subir les esclaves en partance pour l’Amerique dans ce lieu chargé d’histoire 
Le plaque de commémoration de la France est si minable et usée par le temps qu on en a presque honte devant l’un des plus grands crimes contre l’Humanité commis par les colons francais et certains chefs locaux
translated_text: The Slave Route is a very interesting and emotional walk when you imagine the horrors that the slaves had to endure on their way to America in this place steeped in history. The commemorative plaque of France is so shabby and worn by time that one is almost ashamed of one of the greatest crimes against Humanity committed by the French colonists and certain local leaders.

title: Porte du non retour
text: Just there, nothing exceptional. The place is an ancient site with a history. It's a must visit though. The watermelon sold around that vicinity is awesome and so is the coconut. There are other traditional souvenirs one can get too.

title: Paying Homage To My Ancestors
text: A eye opening walk through the door of atrocities that were inflected to the African race for greed. It's so surreal because the monument is on the beach so with such a beautiful backdrop to a horrible history. A cultural landmark that showcases the journey the enslaved took to enter smaller boats to enter the larger boat docked to be taken to places and never see home again. It is sad that so many people were imprisoned but I digress a sight to see and experience and breath in the air and pay homage to the many lives used and lost. The beach is also used for the big Voodoo festival as well.

It's so surreal because the monument is on the beach so with such a beautiful backdrop to a horrible history. title: There are more than just "Doors of No Return"
text: Because of the scale of the enslavement of Africans, there are many doors of no return, embarkation points and points of no return all over West Africa. While Ghana and Senegal's "Doors of No Return" are most celebrated and preserved, there are similar points in Guinea, Sierra Leone, Gambia, the Cameroon and Nigeria. Most of these sites have fallen into ruin and there are no markers to note the horror. We must remember them all.
translated_title: There are more than just "Doors of No Return"

Most of these sites have fallen into ruin and there are no markers to note the horror. We must remember them all.

text: Nous y sommes venus souvent et nous déplorons, d'année en année, la dégradation des lieux. Il va falloir faire quelque chose afin que ce magnifique monument ne soit pas dans le même état de délabrement que la plupart des lieux historiques du Bénin.

title: World Heritage Site
text: Right there on the beach - Ouidah Plage - stands the memorial built by UNESCO to commemorate the horrors of the slave trade which saw several thousands of Africans sold as slaves and shipped off across the Atlantic Ocean. La Porte du Non-retour (Door of No Return marks the final leg of the slave route where they bid farewell to Africa forever.

title: Un monument intéressant à visiter
text: A voir, en passant à Ouidah. Un monument symbolique, rappelant la traite des esclaves, le départ par mer vers une destination inconnue. L'horreur de l'exploitation et de l'esclavage.

title: Slave route - a history lesson on human rights
text:
Our visit to Ouidah centred around the slave route.

We followed the route from the slave market in the middle of town along the 4 km trek to the sea. Slaves were forced to walk,  chained together (neck to neck), in the blistering heat or pounding rain to be boarded onto ships awaiting departure for the Americas. 

We also visited the museum which is housed in the old Portuguese fort in Ouidah. At the museum we learned that the slave trade was not one-sided. The Dahomey kings traded slaves for gifts and weapons from the Europeans. 

Visiting the slave route is a sombre experience similar to visiting a holocaust camp. We all know what happened but seeing the site first-hand makes you really think what it must have been like for the victims. 

 At the place where the slave route meets the sea is the the Door of No Return. The monument was erected in 1994 in memory of the 15,000,000 slaves that boarded those ships. It's estimated that for every slave that boarded a ship another died en route to the coast. 

This is a must-see if you're travelling in Benin.

We also visited the museum which is housed in the old Portuguese fort in Ouidah. At the museum we learned that the slave trade was not one-sided. The Dahomey kings traded slaves for gifts and weapons from the Europeans. 

Visiting the slave route is a sombre experience similar to visiting a holocaust camp. We all know what happened but seeing the site first-hand makes you really think what it must have been like for the victims.

title: Sehr beeindruckend, wunderschöner Strand
text: Durch dieser Bogen mussten damals die Sklaven' die vorher 4 km weiter in Ouidah in der Festung zusammengepfercht wurden, gehen. Der Weg finde von der Festung quasi gerade aus bis zum Meer, wo bereits die Zweimaster warteten auf die Überfahrt nach Amerika. Leider konnten viele erschöpfte Sklaven diese Boote nicht mehr erreichen, oder versuchten von den Beibooten zu springen und ertranken qualvoll. Alles war Ihnen lieber, als in dieser unbekannte Zukunft als Sklave abgeführt zu werden. Es ist sehr beeindruckend, diesen Weg als freier Mensch zu gehen, und dieser Manmal ist eine schöne Hommage an den armen Seelen

text:
Pour faire la route, il faut d abord passer a l office du tourisme pour payer. Un enfant du pays (guide) voys accompagne pendant 1h jusqu a la porte de non retour. Qui ne represent aucun interet en elle-meme, mais les histoires racontees par le guide sont tres interessantes.
Ca vaut le coup!

title: Perhaps the Main Attraction of Benin
text:
The monument itself is underwhelming but still interesting. 

It is basically a gate with some sculptures on the beach, facing the sea...

The visit won't take long (maybe 10-20 minutes if you really focus on the details), but there are guides for hire, who can give you some more information and offer to show you other sites related to the slave trade (the trees, the ditch...)... I hired a guide only for the Porte du Non Retour. To be honest, I did not find it very interesting and most information is information you'll find online...

The guide costs 2000CFA for the Gate tour (and I believe 5000CFA if you want them to take you to the other sites), so might as well get one to inject some money in the local economy...

Not far from this monument (200 meters) is the Porte du Retour, which is a but unrelated, and focuses on the arrival of Christian missionaries.

title: Tor zur Erinnerung an die Sklavereigeschichte
text: Das Tor ist ein modern designtes Bauwerk, aber die Geschichte dahinter ist tragisch. Man sollte sich viel über die Sklavereigeschichte erzählen lassen, um das Ausmaß der Inhumanität zu verstehen.

title: Super guide
text: On venait voir la porte du non retour lorsqu'on est tombé sur Geoffroy. Guide depuis 9 ans, très bon guide. Il nous a fait une visite bien plus importante que tout les autres guides qui passaient par là avec leurs clients et on l'a gardé pour le festival Vodoun. On en a eu plein les yeux et on a appris énormément de choses.

title: La porte de non retour d'où vous reviendrez changer !
text:
La porte de non-retour est un emplacement symbolique et à absolument voir lorsque nous somme de passage sur Ouidah. 

Cet endroit est chargé d'émotions et ne nous pouvons qu'être désemparé face à cette histoire dont nous sommes tous concernés.
translated_title: The door of no return from which you will return changed!
translated_text: The Door of No Return is a symbolic site and a must-see when visiting Ouidah. This place is charged with emotion, and we can only be distraught in the face of this story, which concerns us all.

title: A monument that really makes you think about History of slavery
text: This monument is a symbol as well as a great well maintained architectural conception. It has a significant importance for the cultural history of Benin. There is also a small market besides that sells souvenirs.

title: History of slavery
text: Very moving place showing the "door of no return" which Slaves passed through to board ships for abroad. Amazing detail on the reliefs.

title: Om stil van te zijn
text: Als je van Ouidah richting la porte du non retour loopt, denk dan eens aan de slaven die richting de west gingen en wisten dat ze nooit meer terug kwamen. In Ouidah zijn ze van hun identiteit beroofd en aangekomen bij de plek waar de poort staat lagen de schepen klaar. Een hele indrukwekkende plek, maar trek zeker ook even de tijd uit om het geheel te ervaren!
translated_text: As I van Ouidah richting the door of no return loopt, denk dan eens aan de slaven die richting de west gingen en wisten dat ze nooit meer terug kwamen. In Ouidah, you have your identity beroofd and you have to change your name. If you are indrukwekkende plek, maar trek zeker ook even de tijd uit om het geheel te ervaren!

title: Overwhelmed with the details
text: If you looking for real facts about slavery, this is the place. The story begins from the cha-cha place, all the way to where the rituals are performed till the last slave got on board the ship. It was sober reflection moment for me. It could be quite challenging if you do not understand French or any of the local languages fon or yoruba. A guide could charge as much as 5000cfa and it's nice to buy them lunch as well. Be careful because someone might take advantage of you in that town especially money related.

title: Sobering place to visit
text: Beautiful Memorial to all those who left right from this beach to the New World during the slave era. Rather unfortunately it is not being kept as it should!
translated_text: Beautiful Memorial to all those who left right from this beach to the New World during the slave era. Rather unfortunately it is not being kept as it should!

title: Frightning
text: One has always to remember the past and learn for the future. ...the place could be cleaner to honor the human beings having been dragged through this so peaceful place.
translated_text: One has always to remember the past and learn for the future. ...the place could be cleaner to honor the human beings having been dragged through this so peaceful place.

title: Um pouco de nossa história
text:
Visitar o Porte du non retour, em Ouidah, é conhecer um pouco da nossa história. 
Quando os escravos africanos chegavam a determinado ponto do litoral beninense, sabiam que não voltariam mais. O Portal é para nos lembrar de tudo isso.
translated_title: A little bit of our history
translated_text: Visit the Door of No Return, in Ouidah, to learn about our history. When our African slaves were determined to be on the Benin coast coast, it was no choice but. O Portal é para nos lembrar de tudo isso.

title: A very strong reminder of the slavery
text: The place is suggestive, on the beach in front of the magnificent Benin Atlantic Ocean. Very quite and somehow peaceful. Worth a visit.
translated_title: A very strong reminder of the slavery
translated_text: The place is suggestive, on the beach in front of the magnificent Benin Atlantic Ocean. Very quite and somehow peaceful. Worth a visit.

title: La storia ne fa il fascino
text: Luogo molto semplice ma la storia e il percorso per arrivare alla porta degli schiavi fanno capire quanto era triste la realtà !
translated_title: La storia ne fa il fascino
translated_text: Many times I have the story and it seems to arrive at the door of the fanno capire when the reality will be sad!

title: Simples, não há muito o que ver mas tem um significado histórico simbólico
text: É um local simples, chamando-se "porta do não retorno" devido a um monumento em forma de portal simbolizando uma passagem pelo qual os africanos escravizados que passavam por lá já não mais voltariam a sua terra natal. Não há muito o que ver, é um litoral. Mas existe esse significado histórico, essa simbologia, que não deixa de ter seu apelo, especialmente para os filhos da "diaspora negra" e para os africanos que ficaram.
translated_title: Simples, não há muito o que ver mas tem um significado histórico simbólico

title: Au bord de la façade atlantique
text:
La porte du non retour clôt un parcours mais en ouvre un autre. 

Ici s’arrête un chemin. Celui qui part des contrées africaines aux bateaux négriers à destination de l’Europe et de l’Amérique.

Ici commence un autre parcours, l’enfer des les calles négrières, le début d’une autre vie de servitude.
translated_title: On the edge of the Atlantic coast
translated_text: The door of no return closes one journey but opens another. Here one path ends. The one that leads from African lands to slave ships bound for Europe and America. Here another journey begins, the hell of the slave holds, the beginning of another life of servitude.

title: История африканских рабов
text: Памятник работорговли, как не должны жить люди, чтобы один поработил другого, здесь шли по улице, построенной рабами.
translated_text: The problem is that it doesn't matter what you're doing. поработил другого, здесь шли по улице, построенной рабами.

title: De passage au Bénin, endroit à voir!
text:
Lieu important de l'histoire du Bénin, parcours à faire à pied et pourquoi pas accompagné d'un guide.

Émotions garanties.
translated_title: Passing through Benin, a place to see!
translated_text: An important site in Benin's history, this tour can be done on foot, or perhaps with a guide. Emotions guaranteed.

title: Elegantly sobering reminder
text: Located on the beach near Ouidah, the elegant arch is a poignant reminder of the horror of being loaded on a ship as property to sell in the new world, never to see your family and home again.
translated_text: Located on the beach near Ouidah, the elegant arch is a poignant reminder of the horror of being loaded on a ship as property to sell in the new world, never to see your family and home again.

title: An incredible experience
text: It is a memorial to all the slaves taken from Benin and sold in the American continent (Brazil and the caribean, mostly). The local guides provide you with the historical background and make your tour a much better experience. Take the time to listen to them and reward them with a little tip (about 1.500 to 2.000 XOF is reasonable). They deserve it.
translated_text: It is a memorial to all the slaves taken from Benin and sold in the American continent (Brazil and the caribean, mostly). The local guides provide you with the historical background and make your tour a much better experience. Take the time to listen to them and reward them with a little tip (about 1.500 to 2.000 XOF is reasonable). They deserve it.

title: Poignant reminder of slavery in West Africa
text:
This particular sight serves as a poignant reminder of the thousands of West Africans who walked across this beach to a life of slavery (or death en route).  However, rather than heading straight here, I suggest that you find a guide in the city (there are plenty near the museums or Temple of Pythons) and tour the entire slave route.  It only takes about 40 minutes, but it will give you a greater sense of the inhumanity of Man.

The gate itself is a stunning memorial with four fabulous iron sculptures at each corner.  My heart sank as I walked through, knowing that I could return, whereas slaves would only ever return in spirit, never in body.

This is must-see!

On ne peut s’empêcher de se mettre à la place de ces gens qui ont été arraché à leur terre natale pour être placé sous le joug de l'esclavage des occidentaux. La souffrance passée s'y ressent encore.
translated_text: Another must-see if you're passing through Ouidah. This site is an important place in Benin's history. One can't help but put oneself in the shoes of these people who were torn from their native land to be placed under the yoke of Western slavery. The suffering of the past is still felt.

title: History at its peak
text: It was great to know the history of the slaves During that time. We walked the same road they did upto the port. It was so heartbreaking. I cried.

title: Émouvant
text: C'est une visite très émouvante surtout après le parcours de la route des esclaves en passant par le village où se trouve la case de zomai ainsi que le cimetière des esclaves. Triste d'imaginer ces milliers d'êtres humains arrachés à leur terre et déportés en pays inconnu à l'époque.  Le site est très intéressant. A voir
translated_text: It is a very moving visit, especially after the slave route through the village where the Zomai hut and the slave cemetery are located. It is sad to imagine these thousands of human beings torn from their land and deported to a country unknown at the time. The site is very interesting. A must-see.

title: Visite émouvante  et de mémoires

A very interesting group of voodoo priests and followers.
Also the gate was very moving.

Em frente ao portão existem alguns comerciantes, alguns objetos são interessantes! Vale a pena conferir.

title: Reminds of history's complicity and tragic moments
text: Specialists say that much of what you can see in present-day Ouidah as related to the history of slave trade does not follow history strictly. It may well be so. Yet, such monuments in any case remind us of how tragic history can be. The details can be unauthentic but the feelings such monuments rise are definitely related to historical truth, whatever it could be.

si arriva alla Porta del non ritorno attraverso la rotta degli schiavi, con una buona guida (Faustine, trovato al Museo) si capisce bene, passo dopo passo, il delirio dell'uomo conquistatore.

text: à voir c'est tout mais ne pas s'attendre à quelque chose d'extraordinaire. translated_text: It's all there is to see, but don't expect anything extraordinary. For those going there for the voodoo festival on January 10, be sure not to buy the photo passes sold by the Ouidah tourist office (which are not recognized by the festival organizers - it's just theft).

title: A very moving monument.
text: The beauty of this location stands in stark contrast to the terrible history it memorializes.  This beachside monument marks the place where untold numbers of African slaves departed from their homeland. The images on the monuments largely speak for themselves, however I would still strongly recommend obtaining a local guide to provide further explanation of the historical and cultural significance of this place. Overall, I highly recommend visitors to this area of Africa to take a trip to see this and the other elements in this town which memorialize the slave trade.

This beachside monument marks the place where untold numbers of African slaves departed from their homeland. The images on the monuments largely speak for themselves, however I would still strongly recommend obtaining a local guide to provide further explanation of the historical and cultural significance of this place. Overall, I highly recommend visitors to this area of Africa to take a trip to see this and the other elements in this town which memorialize the slave trade.

title: Diesen 6 km langen Weg sollte man auf jeden Fall sich ansehen
text: Es ist der alte Weg, der vom Sklavenmarkt in Ouidah bis zum Strand verläft( zum Verladen der insgesamt 11,8 Mio Sklaven, die damals vorwiegend von hier nach Südamerika verschifft wurden. Die Skulpturen am Rande sind brasilianischen Ursprungs. Gerade nach Benin sind dim 18. und 19. Jahrhundert viele Nachkommen der damaligen Sklaven in ihre alte Heimat zurück gegehrt, nach dem Sie in der neuen Welt zu Reichtum gekommen sind. Sie begründeten sie besidnere afro-brasilianische Archtitektur, wovon noch vielin OUidah zu sehen ist. Diewer " Sklavenweg " gehört einfach dazu!

title: Ok.
text: It just looked Ok. There was a tour guide and we took some pictures. We went to the Porte du non retour on our way out of Ouidah so were in a hurry. it did not leave a lasting impression.
translated_text: It just looked Ok. There was a tour guide and we took some pictures. We went to the Porte du non retour on our way out of Ouidah so were in a hurry. it did not leave a lasting impression.

title: a voir...
text:
Bien entendu, cette construction ne date pas de l'époque de l'esclavage et est un monument commémoratif.

On ne peut pas, à mon avis arriver comme ça, presque par hasard devant ce symbole aussi terriblement chargé d'histoire. 
On doit s’imprégner tout d'abord du drame qu'ont vécus plus d'un million d'esclaves en ces lieux, certains préférant mourir sur place plutôt que de partir...
Pour cela, il est nécessaire de faire le chemin en commençant par le commencement, à savoir la visite de l' ancien fort portugais, actuel musée de Ouidah, et de suivre le chemin de 4 km qu'empruntaient les esclaves jusqu'à cette plage.

C'est un lieu à respecter, c'est un lieu de mémoire.
Et...Même si la plage est magnifique , on ne doit pas oublier les souffrances qui ont été vécues ici.
translated_text: Of course, this construction does not date from the time of slavery and is a commemorative monument. In my opinion, one cannot just arrive like that, almost by chance, in front of this symbol so terribly charged with history. One must first of all immerse oneself in the drama that more than a million slaves experienced in these places, some preferring to die on the spot rather than leave... To do this, it is necessary to make the journey starting at the beginning, namely the visit of the old Portuguese fort, now the Ouidah museum, and to follow the 4 km path that the slaves took to this beach. It is a place to be respected, it is a place of memory. And... Even if the beach is magnificent, one must not forget the suffering that was experienced here.

title: La memoire du lieu merite mieux
text: La memoire de ces lieux meriterait d´etre mieux preservee. La ville est tres riche d´histoire mais les commentaires des guides sont tres approximatifs. Ceci est dommage parce que ces imprecisions transforme en legendes des evenements historiques qui devraient etre preserves de l´oubli.
translated_title: The memory of the place deserves better
translated_text: The memory of these places deserves to be better preserved. The city is very rich in history, but the guides' commentaries are very approximate. This is a shame because these inaccuracies transform historical events that should be preserved from oblivion into legends.

title: Powerful
text: The whole slaved road in Ouidah is moving, and the Porte du Non Retour is a strong finish.  To stand where so many were taken from their families and everything they knew, to be loaded like cattle (or worse) into the hold of a ship, and send off to slavery, on what is now a beautiful and picturesque is horrifying.  I'm glad I went, though, as it helps bring home to me something that only existed in the history books.
translated_text: The whole slaved road in Ouidah is moving, and the Porte du Non Retour is a strong finish.  To stand where so many were taken from their families and everything they knew, to be loaded like cattle (or worse) into the hold of a ship, and send off to slavery, on what is now a beautiful and picturesque is horrifying.  I'm glad I went, though, as it helps bring home to me something that only existed in the history books.

title: Un lieu d'histoire chargé d'émotion
text:
« La Porte du non retour » est un monument qui rappelle le départ de milliers d’esclaves vers le nouveau monde. Il est inscrit au patrimoine mondial de l'Unesco. C'est un lieu de mémoire symbolisé par un grand monument présentant des fresques qui rappellent l'exil de milliers de noirs enchaînés et entassés dans des bateaux pour une traversée d'où on ne revenait pas... Ce monument se dresse sur la grande plage au bout d'une longue rue venant du centre de la ville Ouidah, bordée ça et là de quelques statues en rapport avec l'histoire du lieu. On a assez vite fait le tour de « la porte », mais la grande plage et la mer sont superbes et l'on se sent pris par l'ambiance de ce lieu tellement chargé d'émotion par ce drame de l'humanité !
Quelques artisans proposent le production à proximité.
translated_title: A place of history charged with emotion
translated_text: "The Door of No Return" is a monument that commemorates the departure of thousands of slaves to the New World. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a place of remembrance symbolized by a large monument with frescoes that recall the exile of thousands of black people chained and crammed into boats for a crossing from which there was no return... This monument stands on the large beach at the end of a long street coming from the center of Ouidah, lined here and there with a few statues related to the history of the place. We quickly went around "the door", but the large beach and the sea are superb and we feel taken by the atmosphere of this place so charged with emotion by this tragedy of humanity! Some artisans offer the production nearby.
